questions.question_text: An administrator wants to deploy Apple Volume Purchase Program (VPP) applications but receives the Error Code 12046. What is most likely the issue?

choices.D: The firewall is blocking the required ports for vmware.apple.com.
choices.B: The sToken has expired and needs to be renewed.
choices.C: The Microsoft Azure AD integration is missing.
choices.A: The administrative user account is locked.

questions.question_text:
Users are able to list all of their repositories through the content gateway of the Unified Access Gateway (UAG). After an attempt to open a SMB repository, the users are required to provide a username and password.
Which two can cause the issue? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
B and C are correct according with the correct reference:

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/services/WS1_Content_Gateway.pdf

choices.D: Having multiple repository on the same domain is not supported.
choices.E: Content gateway does not support SMB repository.
choices.B: Smb.conf needs to be edited if there are multiple repository in the same domain.
choices.C: A Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) needs to be added to the resolv.conf.
choices.A: Port 80 should be verified to make sure it is not blocked between the device and the content gateway.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is required to manually set up VMware Identity Manager in the Workspace ONE UEM.
Which type of REST API account is required? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Seems that C & D are correct. Here the updated reference link:

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE/services/WS1-Access-deploymentguide/GUID-0AC4DCE9-A41B-4B8B-9953-F9874B04C575.html
I think C is correct. Device Health Attestation is only available from Windows 10 1709 and later.
A. The device does not support UEFI Secure Boot.

choices.D: Device Health Attestation is not supported on Windows devices.
choices.B: Health attestation is only working with ENS.
choices.A: The device does not support UEFI Secure Boot.
choices.C: The device is using the wrong windows version.

questions.question_text:
Workspace ONE UEM sends the following notification about a Windows 10 device
"A Health Attestation sample has not been received from the device."
What can cause this issue?

choices.D: The administrator has deployed G-Suite with direct integration.
choices.A: Hyperlink protection is not supported on Office 365 Exchange Online.
choices.B: The administrator is using Exchange 2016 with SEG v2.
choices.C: Hyperlink protection is not working with Workspace ONE UEM.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Only A or D are credible. But D assumes the admin doesn't remember there is no SEG in between.

The answer is correct, Some people confuses "Hyperlink Protection" with "Email attachments" or "Hyperlink transformation".
 
 A is correct according: 

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/2011/WS1_MEM_Guide/GUID-AWT-PRTCT-ATTCH-HPRLNKS.html

Answer: D 
Direct Integration for gmail does not support hyperlink protection.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/1907/WS1_MEM_Doc.pdf

questions.question_text:
An administrator has defined an email policy for hyperlink protection for emails that contain a hyperlink that can only be opened using the VMware browser. When the administrator tests the functionality, the hyperlink is still opened in the native browser of the device.
What causes this issue?
